main event: An unidentified object was observed by aircrew members near Hill City, Kansas in November 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as football-shaped with rounder ends,The object was metallic silver grey and seemed to become brighter during movement,It had a brighter ring around the oval similar to the ring around the planet Saturn,The object remained stationary over a B-47 for about a minute before rising vertically until it disappeared,Ground observers at Dyess AFB had noted the planet Venus being quite bright on the horizon at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: oval-shaped object with a brighter ring
witness description: The observers were Major William B. Taft and 1/LT Joshua M. Hinson, both experienced aircrew members and considered reliable.
